list.name: Changes
list.comment: Begun work on monthly payment functionality, and removed additional resources used for deprecated login system.

task.summary: Default task
Project Created.
Project Created.
Project Created.
Added the ability to read from and write to Excel spreadsheets via a separate class.
Added some small improvements to the spreadsheet class.
Updated .gitIgnore
Updated .gitIgnore
Begun work on the FinancialManagementSystem class

Program now runs primarily out of the FinancialManagementSystem class, which Main calls when the program is first started. Added a new interface called 'Colors' to hold specialized color choices for the program, I.e. 'Financial Blue' for the JFrame backgrounds. Also begun work on the Deposit class and updated icon images a bit.
Small Developments with U.I.
Update Date method added to FMS
Begun work on keeping track of dates and adding entries for missed days.
Spreadsheet class can now correctly enter dates into the spreadsheet with proper formatting.
Added functionality to correctly enter default information for missing entries.
Made improvements to date management and the FinancialManagementSystem class in general.

Fixed a bug in the ExcelSpreadsheet class where trying to display pure text information from a spreadsheet would cause an error. Also cleared out the addMissingEntries() method in the FinancialManagementSystem class to begin a complete rework on how the process is handled.
Started work on accounting for missing entries.
Continued losing my mind trying to fix the addMissingEntries() method, but made progress and got the enterNewYear() method working completely as expected.
Completed functionality for filling out the rest of the entries in a spreadsheet for a given year, as well as added proper formatting for currency being written to a spreadsheet.

The program can now account for any missing dates within a given spreadsheet. Additionally, if the program hasn't been used since the previous year, and there does not exist a spreadsheet with the system's current year as it's name, an error will no longer be thrown. Instead, the findSpreadsheet() method which has been added to the FinancialManagementSystem class will now use a for-loop (Starting at the system's current year and ending at the year 2001) to decrement through previous years until it finds an Excel file with the given year as its name. As of now, regardless of how long it has been since the user has last used the program, everything should run correctly, and then continue as normal after a new spreadsheet has been created for that year, and all missing entries have been accounted for in all spreadsheets in-between.

Various small improvements, including setting custom colors for the pie chart, still displays a red and blue, but the red will now consistently be representative of how much you've spent, while blue shows how much you have saved, previously the colors would be assigned randomly.
Fixed bug in the pie chart class.

Fixed a bug in the FinancialManagementSystem class where if the last date of a spreadsheet was the last day of that year (I.e. 12/31/2022), the program would enter all of the information for the following year (I.e. 2023) in that spreadsheet, and continue endlessly. It now functions as expected and will simply create a new spreadsheet for the following year in such an event. Also continued work on the U.I. in both the UserInterface and Deposit class, as well as adjusted the Fonts interface to include different size options for the Roboto font.

Turns out there was still a problem with the Pie chart displaying colors correctly, fixed all bugs in that department, and now it will always color the spent percentage red, and the saved percentage blue.

Improved rendering of the balance text by making its size and position dynamic, based on how large it's quantity is, so the text always appears mostly centered. Also began work on the Expenditure class, and made an icon for the new window. It's JFrame appearance will be more or less the same as the Deposit class, with minor differences where necessary.
Continued work on the Deposit class.
Added purchase summary JTextArea in the Expenditure class.

Added functionality for the confirm button in both the Deposit and Expenditure class. Balance will now automatically refresh upon submitting a new deposit or expenditure, the pie-chart, however, will not. Lots of problems trying to get that to work, removed all efforts for now, will have to return to this problem later. Everything else looking great, will probably aim to get purchase summaries working next.

The primary UserInterface now refreshes when a new expenditure is added, so both the balance text and pie-chart is updated without needing additional methods for each of them. Also implemented the correct functionality for adding purchase descriptions, and made the program display a basic error message within the Expenditure JFrame if the user tries to submit a new expenditure with the default text in the TextArea. The Error message is displayed in a new color added to the Colors interface, ERROR_RED.

Added some more error checks to both the Deposit and Expenditure class, so that now, no matter what input the user tries to give within the text boxes, if it is not usable by the program, it will be rejected with a clear explanation as to why. Also cleaned up some things and added small optimizations all over the map. The project is now officially ready for version 1.0 release. In future version, I'd like to focus primarily on adding new functionality, I.e. a way to view your purchase and deposit history, and maybe even things to keep track of different reoccurring payments. But for the time being, I'm satisfied enough with how things are to officially give the release of the program.
Updated to .gitignore and the pom.xml, taken for final release.

Fixed mistake with the Expenditure class, where if the user entered letters into the expenditure text box, the error message that appeared would state that a valid number is required in order to make a new 'deposit'. Changed it to say expenditure as it should.
Added a file to gitIgnore.

Officially began work on Version 2.0 of the Financial Management System; which will include a secure login functionality to allow the user's spreadsheet to be stored on a Dropbox server and downloaded anytime they run the application and login. This is so that if one user is using the program between multiple computers, changes made to their financial data on one are uploaded to the server, then downloaded when they run the FMS on the other computer, resulting in consistency between computers without having to manually transfer spreadsheets.

Finished work on implementing the basic login, download, and upload systems, and have now begun work on a 'DownloadSpreadsheetPrompt' class, which will allow the user, after they've successfully logged-in, to decide if they want to download the most recent version of the spreadsheet on the server to replace the one currently on their computer.

Fixed the expiring credentials problem with the Dropbox API, access token is now refreshed automatically when the program is run, and validity of that token is checked just before any API call is made, ensuring an expired token will never be an issue. Also re-formatted and added some new colors to the color class, and touched on visually displaying errors that may occur throughout the registration and login processes.
Finished the GetUser() method in the Login class, and made general improvements to methods in both the ExcelSpreadsheet and the FinancialManagementSystem class.

Updated the DownloadSpreadsheetPrompt class to the SpreadsheetDownloader class, and added its base functionality. A user could now login securely, and then decide whether or not to download the last uploaded version of their spreadsheet from the database before opening the main portion of the program.
Added the SpreadsheetUploader class as well as implemented its core functionality. The program is now runnable from start to finish with the new changes and everything works as expected.
Added the SpreadsheetUploader class as well as implemented its core functionality. The program is now runnable from start to finish with the new changes and everything works as expected.
New Project Directory Created.
New Project Directory Created.
New Project Directory Created.
Removed remnants of previous version of project.
Begun work on monthly payment functionality, and removed additional resources used for deprecated login system.

option.value: Begun work on monthly payment functionality, and removed additional resources used for deprecated login system.
